sources.title: Latest imported feed items on ArmchairCelts

articles.description:
MOUSSA DEMBELE could be on his way to the Premier League this summer, but it’s not great news for Celtic,. The bhoys sold Moussa for a record fee at the time [£21m] to French side Lyon but also added a sell-on clause. The Hoops always look to get a little extra out of their top […]
Source
articles.title: Moussa Dembele’s Sell On Clause

articles.description:
Joe Ledley thinks Kyogo Furuhashi is going to be even better for Celtic over the coming season than he was last term, greatly praising the Japanese sensation. The Welshman also thinks this special group are going to win the title again. Kyogo made a wonderful impact at the Bhoys in his debut campaign, arriving last ...
The post Joe Ledley makes class Celtic prediction that will be tough for rivals to hear appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: Joe Ledley makes class Celtic prediction that will be tough for rivals to hear

articles.description:
ANGE POSTECOGLOU has delivered a double injury boost for Celtic fans ahead of the next phase of pre-season. The Hoops played out a 3-3 draw against Rapid Vienna on Saturday but did so without Josip Juranovic or Anthony Ralston. Ange allowed Osaze Urhoghide to play at right back in their absence but the defender didn’t […]
Source
articles.title: Double Injury Boost: Ange Clears Up Weekend Mystery

articles.description:
Osaze Urhoghide has had a surprisingly prominent role to play in Celtic’s opening pre-season games, being the only player who has completed both 90 minutes against Wiener Viktoria and Rapid Vienna. Urhoghide has been primarily used as a right-back over both games but also slotted in as a centre-back when Christopher Jullien went off against ...
The post Celtic fringe player praised by Postecoglou after Austria shift appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: Celtic fringe player praised by Postecoglou after Austria shift

articles.description:
Celtic manager Ange Postecoglou has provided an update on Anthony Ralston and Josip Juranovic after they were missing from Saturday’s match squad against Rapid Vienna. The Bhoys boss named almost the entire Austrian group on the bench behind the starters in the 3-3 draw, but the two right-backs were not listed, leading to concerns about ...
The post Ange Postecoglou provides injury update after Saturday Celtic absences appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: Ange Postecoglou provides injury update after Saturday Celtic absences

articles.description:
Ange Postecoglou has made it clear that Celtic’s reported bid for Dylan Reid is not relevant in terms of strengthening the first team this summer. Football Scotland has reported that Celtic have had a £125,000 offer accepted for the St Mirren talent, who is still just 17. There’s an expectation other teams could make bids ...
The post Celtic manage expectations as outlets get excited about weekend transfer update appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: Celtic manage expectations as outlets get excited about weekend transfer update

articles.description: If you believe what you read in the papers, all is well inside Ibrox and nobody is worried at all. Players are being brought in. Negotiations are underway. The media is presenting a picture of calm over there. It is, as usual, covering a multitude of issues. Ibrox’s transfer policy has failed, and failed utterly. […]
articles.title: The Aribo Transfer Fee Has Sparked Panic At Ibrox And Led To A Major Strategic Error.

articles.description:
We’re not in the business of looking for negatives when it comes to Celtic. We are a fan media site who always want to be supportive of the club and the players. However, we’re not the Celtic View and when there’s something up for discussion we won’t shy way from it. There are fans out […]
Source
articles.title: Celtic Player Who Should Be Moved On This Summer

articles.description:
Banik Ostrava are expecting a strong crowd for Wednesday night’s clash at home to Celtic, with captain Jan Lastuvka predicting it will be “a real feast” for those in attendance. Celtic have been invited by the Czech club as part of their centenary celebrations and ticket sales have been strong for the encounter. The fixture ...
The post Banik Ostrava captain hypes up Wednesday's Celtic clash; strong crowd and atmosphere expected appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: Banik Ostrava captain hypes up Wednesday's Celtic clash; strong crowd and atmosphere expected

articles.description:
Photo by Craig Williamson/SNS Group via Getty Images
  

 The hoops second pre season game this summer resulted in an entertaining 3-3 draw with Rapid Vienna. 
Here’s the goals in case you missed them:

Not a lot to take away from games like this where it’s all about fitness, but it was good to see Hatate, O’Riley and Kyogo looking sharp, and it’s good of Joseph Hart to get the blunders out the way now before the domestic campaign kicks off.
There was an immediate reaction to the match on 67HH yesterday which you can find below!
articles.title: Rapid 3-3 Celtic - Goals & Reaction

articles.description: Last week, the Ibrox club made it known that John Park is now working for them. I wrote a piece on that where I pointed out that our fans would not be losing sleep over it. Today Keevins has written about it in his column; he seems to think it’s a masterstroke. But once again, […]
articles.title: Why Celtic Will Always Have The Edge Over Our Rivals In The Transfer Market Gold Rush.

articles.description: Celtic have had a bid accepted for St Mirren youngster Dylan Reid, according to a report from Football Scotland.  The lowdown: Hot prospect Part of the academy system in Paisley, the 17-year-old made a professional debut for the Premiership side in March 2021 against the Hoops’ Old Firm rivals having just turned 16. Soon after, […]
articles.title: Offer accepted: Celtic close to signing £225k-rated gem for Ange; he's 'excellent on the ball'

articles.description: MATT O’RILEY marked his first appearance since the middle of May with the opening goal in Celtic’s 3-3 draw with Rapid Vienna in the Allianz Stadium. The cultured playmaker, who was excused pre-season traiing at Lennoxtown the previous week after Under-21 international duty with Denmark, curled in the opener during his 45-minute outing, as CQN [...]
articles.title: ‘PERFECT TEST,’ ADMITS O’RILEY

articles.description: Maurice Johnston was born in Glasgow on 13 April 1963. He began his career at Partick Thistle in 1981, scoring 41 goals in 85 appearances, before winning a transfer to Elton John’s Watford in 1983. Johnston scored 23 league goals in English football, made his international debut, and helped the team reach 1984 FA Cup Read More
articles.title: Judas Day of Infamy – A despicable deed done to hurt Celtic

articles.description:
Callum McGregor played his first match since February without his now trademark protective face mask. The Celtic Captain marched on last season after a very significant cheekbone injury suffered during a Scottish Cup tie. Celtic supporters have grown to love the Celtic Captain’s mask and his performances in it. Not long after Callum sustained the […]
Source
articles.title: Callum McGregor Drops Title Winning Mask
